Functionality¶

mars.utils.func.InDepthUpdateDictAwithB(A: Dict[str, Any], B: Dict[str, Any]) → None[source]¶

A function for update nested dictionaries A with B.

Parameters

  • A (dict) – a nested dictionary, e.g., dict, dict of dict, dict of dict of dict …

  • B (dict) – a nested dictionary, e.g., dict, dict of dict, dict of dict of dict …

Returns

none

mars.utils.func.LoadYAML2Dict(yaml_file: str, toAttr: bool = False, mergeWith: str = 'mars/confs/default.yaml', confs: Dict[str, Any] = {}) → mars.utils.data_struct.AttrDict[source]¶

A function loading the hyper-parameters in yaml file into a dictionary.

Parameters

  • yaml_file (str) – the yaml file name

  • toAttr (bool, optional) – if True, transform the configuration dictionary into a class, such that each hyperparameter can be called with class.attribute instead of dict[‘attribute’]; defaults to False

  • mergeWith – if not None, merge the loaded yaml (with overwritting priority) with the yaml given by this path;

for example, merging with default yaml file will fill those missing entries with those in defaulf configurations. :type mergeDefault: string or None, optional :param confs: input a dictionary of configurations from outside the function, defaults to {} :type confs: dict, optional :return: a dictionary of configurations, including all hyper-parameters for environment, algorithm and training/testing. :rtype: dict

mars.utils.func.UpdateDictAwithB(A: Dict[str, Any], B: Dict[str, Any], withOverwrite: bool = True) → None[source]¶

Update the entries in dictionary A with dictionary B.

Parameters

  • A (dict) – a dictionary

  • B (dict) – a dictionary

  • withOverwrite (bool, optional) – whether replace the same entries in A with B, defaults to False

Returns

none
